resources.string: Have you read Introduction to Computing Systems: From Bits & Gates to C & Beyond written by Yale N. Patt & Sanjay J. Patel? This app is the simulation of the LC-3 computer. This app uses imagebuttons, and the legends are as follow:
It is seen in the both SIMULATOR & TERMINAL tabs. It is used to reboot the simulator in the former and to clear screen in the latter.
These two buttons are used to RUN and SUSPEND the simulator.
it is used to OPEN and load LC-3 program (in .obj format), and cannot be used while the simulator is RUNNING.
The memdump can only continuously display 0x40 Memory Unit in total, so you need this button to JUMP TO where you want.

There is a input buffer in the simulator, and you can input in it. You can only input while the input buffer is empty. (The upper state means the input buffer is empty and you can input, the lowwer means opposite)
Thanks for using this app. You support me by using my app(s), and your support is my impetus.
This is a free software, and you can find it at https://github.com/FreeBirdLjj/LC3_SIM to do anything you can do with any other GitHub repo.
